entry.title: How to resolve the certificate error in IE browser with Selenium WebDriver
entry.content:
Some website had certificate error when you access to this , it will be blocked by IE browser.

It look like this :

To resolve this you must enter this code below :

``` driver.get(“yourwebsite url that had certificate error”); if(driver instanceof InternetExplorerDriver){

driver.navigate().to("javascript:document.getElementById('overridelink').click()");
Thread.sleep(5000);

} ```

entry.title: How to get the current browser running in real time with WebDriver
entry.content:
In some case of test automation , you need to find out Selenium WebDriver is running in which browser.

So take a look in this example code to know :

``` public String getCurrentBrowserName(WebDriver driver){

if(driver instanceof InternetExplorerDriver){
    return "IE browser";
}else if(driver instanceof FirefoxDriver){
    return "Firefox browser";
}else if(driver instanceof ChromeDriver){
    return "Chrome browser";
}

}

```

entry.title: TipsTricks : Test autocomple menus with Selenium IDE
entry.content:
In the work flow I wanted to test, users are asked to type the first few letters of the name of a US County into a text field. An AJAX request is then triggered to find matching counties, and a list of matches is presented to users.

It looks something like this:

So We will hanlde this by 4 actions :

First you need to type a little word to this text field example like “lake”.

Wait for the ajax load the data with text is present : “Lake County, IL”

Mouse over to this option of select with value is “Lake County, IL”.

Click to the option with text : “Lake County, IL”

Take a look in this image :

entry.title: Selenium IDE : Check Background colour
entry.content:
If you want to check element background colour , take a look in this example :

Your html code look like that :

```

```

Your Selenium Ide will like this to check background of div :

``` command: verifyAttribute

Target : css=div#my_div@style

value : background-color= #0000FF ```

entry.title: Selenium Ide : loop through array variables
entry.content:
If you want Selenium IDE loop through your array ,

let take a look in code this example :

<tr> <td>storeEval</td> <td>new Array("postgresql","mysql");</td> <td>myarray</td> </tr> <tr> <td>getEval</td> <td>index=0;</td> <td></td> </tr> <tr> <td>while</td> <td>index < storedVars['myarray'].length</td> <td></td> </tr> <tr> <td>storeEval</td> <td>index</td> <td>temp</td> </tr> <tr> <td>echo</td> <td>javascript{storedVars['myarray'][storedVars['temp']]}</td> <td></td> </tr> <tr> <td>getEval</td> <td>index++;</td> <td></td> </tr> <tr> <td>endWhile</td> <td></td> <td></td> </tr>

or follower there command in this picture
